Laughter is what makes the world go round. It plays a crucial role in forming friendships and relationships, often leading to romance and marriage. Without laughter, people would be consumed by sadness and depression, causing them to stumble through life with heavy hearts. Stress would be prevalent, potentially escalating conflicts into wars. The survival of the world depends on the presence of laughter, as it brings joy, connection, and lightness to our lives.

Laughter, an essential aspect of life, holds a special place in our hearts. The simple act of laughing can bring comfort and reassurance, signaling that everything is alright in that moment. It has the power to unite people, serving as a form of communication that transcends words. When one person starts laughing, it has a contagious effect, spreading joy and connecting individuals in shared merriment. However, while laughter can foster a sense of togetherness, it is important that it is not used to mock or belittle others. Personal experiences often highlight the transformative impact of laughter in diffusing tension and brightening the mood. Like a spark that ignites a flame, laughter has the ability to illuminate the spirits of many, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere. When the sound of laughter fills the air, it acts as a beacon, drawing others in to share in the happiness and revel in the moment. The universal response to laughter is an eagerness to join in, eager to partake in the joyous occasion. Ultimately, laughter serves as a reminder of the beauty and simplicity of finding humor in everyday life, spreading happiness and forging connections that can uplift the human spirit.

How just one moment can change the entire purpose of one's life. In my case, it was the combination of a friend and a girl that made me see my existence in a whole new light. Reflecting on the past few months, I can't help but chuckle at how quickly my life took a turn for the better. It's amazing how a single person can steer you in the right direction, and in my case, that person was a girl who brought me to church and showed me the power of love. With her by my side, I feel like I am on the path to eternity, guided by faith and affection.  The first time I laid eyes on her, it felt like a jolt of electricity running through my veins. I knew I had to pursue her, and nothing was going to stand in my way. With the encouragement of my friend, I mustered up the courage to approach her, and the rest is history. As we grew closer, I realized that she was not just a passing crush, but someone who held the key to my happiness and purpose.  As our relationship blossomed, I found myself delving deeper into my faith, thanks to a newfound friend who introduced me to the teachings of the Bible. This journey led me to a baptism that solidified my commitment to both my faith and my relationship. With love blooming between us, we decided to take the next step and officially become a couple.  Our time together has been filled with unforgettable moments, from romantic beach outings to thrilling fair rides. But it was a rainy night and a near-fatal accident that truly made me appreciate the precious gift of life and love. As I emerged from the wreckage, battered but alive, her face was the only thing on my mind. In that moment, I knew that I was destined to be with her, no matter what challenges may come our way.  Today, we stand strong together, our love unwavering and our hearts intertwined. I have finally mustered the courage to say those three little words that hold so much meaning - I love you. In her, I have found my purpose, my happiness, and my reason for being. And for that, I am eternally grateful.

Laughter is indeed a vital element in life, bringing people together and creating moments of joy and connection. From trying out new and unconventional bowling techniques to experiencing comical mishaps, we shared countless laughs and created lasting memories. It was a night filled with laughter and camaraderie, reminding me of the importance of finding humor and joy in even the simplest of moments. The day was not a fun one. We all just heard really bad news. None of us were even close to smiling. None of us. Even the people that you always see smiling, they had the most serious look on their faces. It was just a bad day. But then one of our friends, @PERSON1, had a great idea of going online to find something to cheer us up. It truly was an amazing idea. We spent hours on the computer just sitting there looking up ridiculous videos that we knew about, trying to make each other laugh. That's when our day started to be a bit better. But it went back down a bit when a few people left to go home. Only three of us were still at @LOCATION1's house. @PERSON2, @PERSON1, and I were all sitting there watching @LOCATION2 when a show we all loved came on. Psych. It was a new episode too! What a great day it turned out to be. The show is full of really puny and dumb humor, but it fit all three of us, @PERSON1 the most. We were all laughing and having a good time. @PERSON1 was laughing after the show was over. So we asked what was so funny. He just kept laughing. For five minutes, he was laughing. When he finally stopped, we asked again. What was so darn funny? Then he told us, "I was laughing at my own laugh. I sound really weird." That's when we all started laughing. How could he be laughing at his own laugh? We soon realized how hard it was to stop. It turned out to be an okay day after all that happened. Now, whenever we are having a bad day, we just bring up that day where we laughed at ourselves for ten minutes. And the day is all better.

Recently over the weekend of last month, I was fortunate enough to meet my uncle whom I have never consciously met. This to me was a major part of learning about my family because I met up with not only my uncle, but my legitimate comedian aunt who I have known since I could remember, and my father at a local Italian restaurant called Bella Napoli. These three were all siblings, and this allowed me to peer into what siblings will joke about, talk about, and bring forth a feeling of nostalgia for each other. I myself have a stepsister, but the degree of nonsense being presented before me was of a much greater magnitude than I could ever fathom. Everyone was constantly in a state of laughter from the stories of the shenanigans that my father and his brother and sister managed to get into. At one point I started having a very hard time breathing. The stories and all-together bad jokes being distributed made me understand that in my family there have been a long line of relatives who inherited some gene that forces us to tell bad jokes. Not even inappropriate but plain stupid jokes. I realized that my children will be telling bad jokes. We dined there for a couple of hours before my dad had to leave for his home up in New Jersey, and I needed to be taken home to my family here in Pennsylvania. But tomorrow was planned for a day of exploration of Philadelphia and plenty of stupid jokes to be exchanged.  I woke up the next day, got dressed, and prepared myself for laughter I was aware I would be keeling over because of. When I met with my uncle and my aunt as well as my uncle's girlfriend, we set off towards the fish hatchery on what I believe was the Schuylkill River. All the jokes started slow because everyone was tired and still waking for the rest of the day's trip. We arrived at the hatchery and we began by feeding some fish they have out in a pond. We watched the fish as they swam around in their concrete canals for at least twenty minutes. We then progressed through the hatchery and soon returned to the car and made our trip to Valley Forge. Once we had parked outside the park, we could hear the beautiful sound of rushing water, so beautiful I really needed to pee. We walked along the paths and eventually climbed up an outlined path to get a closer view of the river and we were enthralled. I was being tortured by the thought of using the restroom. I was able to hold it, but it shortened our visit to the park which was an inconvenience to everyone else but they obliged. I will remember Valley Forge for its pure natural beauty.  After visiting the park, we were going to the very tourist-friendly town of New Hope. We drove by and I nearly lost my mind when I saw the alpacas. Before we did anything at New Hope, I first found a restroom and we were later all in agreement that we should get something to eat. An Italian themed restaurant was an obvious choice and we decided to satisfy our hunger at this fine establishment. They seated us and our host was a very nice young woman. We scanned the menu for something that sounded appetizing. I had found this restaurant was a winner of tastiest pizza awards. Falling into temptation I had to order one of these pizzas. I do not regret doing this because it was one of the best pizzas I have ever had the delight of eating. After satisfying the hunger plaguing us, our group began to browse the gift shops and the silly novelties that they carried. From bookstores to art galleries to a shop that sold nuts and spices until we came upon an ice-cream shop. After walking around for the day, ice-cream was the best thing in our minds to have at the time. I had a very peculiar flavor with berries in it. But I've yet to try a significantly better flavor. When we got our ice-cream, my uncle began to share stories of New York City which is where he was visiting from. Quite honestly I wish I could have gone back with him to NYC, it sounded like a grand city with plenty of places to explore. Sadly I could not, but it is now my goal to eventually visit him where he is living in NYC. We finished our ice-cream and then made our way toward the car and drove to Philadelphia to eat at a very good Mexican restaurant Los Camaradas. We dined there and our stomach was full of exquisite food, almost an entire day of very tasty and savory delights. That was my uncle's weekend in Pennsylvania. I now wish he would visit more often because of the good time we had on our little expedition across the state with the plethora of bad jokes and stories along with it.

I was late like usual for the bus; barely having any time to sit before it moved. I saw my friends sitting in seats directly behind one in other, and I stopped and said to them, "Guys make it hard to choose." I smiled sarcastically. Person 1, who was sitting behind Person 3, motioned for me to sit with her. I gave Person 1 a quick smile and told her that Person 3 and I would turn around and talk with her. Person 1 smiled as Person 3 leaned her head against my seat. Person 3 and I gave Person 1 about five minutes of quiet, then we started talking with her. About the time we arrived at the middle school, we all were having a swell time. Until then, Person 3 and I were fine! But as soon as the bus left the middle school, we were in an uproar of laughter! Everything Person 1 said made me laugh and everything I said made her laugh too! After we left the middle school though, a little sixth grader came to sit in front of us and boy was he annoying! He kept turning around, giving Person 3 and I weird stares and asking us how many joints we had smoked. Of course that made Person 3 and I crack up even more! I was blabbing about how I had stuff in my biology book. But I was talking about notes! The boy obviously thought I was talking about joints. Well for one, I will not smoke, try it, or let it ever come near me. I thought it was absolutely hilarious that he thought I meant joints. Person 3, who was sitting to the left of me, had her head on the seat crying because Person 1 was laughing so hard. Seeing this, I laughed even harder that the sounds coming out of both of us were the silent and deadly laughter. The boy still turned around with stares and added eyebrows. As soon as we passed the fruit packing company, he started talking in Spanish to us. Now I'm trying to learn Spanish, so I didn't have the faintest idea of what he was saying to us. Neither did Person 3. Of course he didn't know what he was talking about either. He was leaning over in the aisle to talk to these native Spanish speakers who were also watching us with huge smiles on their faces. Being the comedian that I am, I decided to start talking about how he could know more Spanish than me when he was only in sixth grade! He of course quieted right down, but the Spanish speakers were howling with laughter. I mean I was shedding tears by the time Person 3 got off the bus. After Person 1 got off, I decided to check in on ol' Person 1. She looked like she was trying to sleep, so I gently nudged her and she looked up at me. I had personally forgotten about Person 1 in the back until Person 3 got off at her stop. "Are you okay? Do you need a doctor?" Person 1 asked with a confused grin on her face. I tried to talk, but was laughing in between all of my words, so it came out as pea soup! "Okay, now you really scare me!" Person 1 retorted with a serious face. "Oh come on Person 1! I'm supposed to scare you! The freshman scare sophomores, sophomores scare juniors, and juniors scare the seniors?" I explained, laughing in between it all. Still my voice sounded like pea soup. "Sorry, but you still scare me personally. Don't do that!" she belted out laughing. I had put my face over the seat, then lowered my head so that all she could see were my eyes. I then did my eyebrow thing in which I move my eyebrows from one side of my forehead to the other, in a wave motion. I thought that I was making her laugh! Which I was, but the outburst made even more people look at us. I mean the attention was fine. But the boy still would interrupt Person 1 and I. He would just blurt out, "EstÃ¡ bueno? EstÃ¡ bueno?" Person 1 and I again would just look at him. He of course was soaking all the attention in. He then, I think, insulted my mother, which Person 1 pointed out. But I didn't care at that point because I was in such a happy mood that I wasn't going to let someone who I didn't even know ruin it. Both Person 1 and I looked up to see her stop coming up. It was really something to think back to all we have done together on the bus. The famous disappearing bus driver ride was a hilarious day and so was the proofreading my paper bus ride. Good times. I told her this as she was getting off the bus. She laughed

Laughter is a powerful tool that brings people closer together. It has the ability to break down barriers, ease tension, and create bonds between individuals. Laughing together not only brings joy and happiness but also strengthens the bonds between individuals, making life more enjoyable and fulfilling.

Laughter is how me and my friends connect most of the time, and that's how i became friends with a lot of them. You know when your in a new class and you don't know anybody in there so its kinda awkward because you feel like your a loner. I try to make the best of a situation and try to make new friends but I'm not always the best at it, so when i get a chance i make them laugh. First we take baby steps and the more we laugh together it seems like the closer we are to each other. By the end of the semester you don't really like the class but you don't want it to be over because you made such a good friend. The next semester you find out you have a class with that person but they don't like the class so they move out. Then you realize you guys kinda grow apart because you never see each other and if you never talk then it gets kinda awkward. The way we started off our friendship was really by accident but i didn't know many people in the class and the people that i did know weren't really my friends. We sat by each other, and after so long of awkward silence between us two she made a joke and i started to laugh. The next thing we know is within a week and would talk to each other and soon enough we hung out some. About half way through the semester we would get in trouble in class for talking to much and we started to realize we were starting to be best friends. The semester went on and we were hanging out more and more and she was the only one i would hang out with sometimes. By the time the semester was almost over we didn't know what our classes were so we thought we would be split up. The day we got our schedules we talked to each other and seen what our classes were. We seen we had one class together and we were excited. The first day of the second semester we went into the art class that we had together and we were laughing the whole time. At the end of the period she told me she didn't want to be in that class because shes not an artsy type of person. I went to my sixth period and was wondering if she was actually going to switch out like she said or not. At the end of sixth period I seen her and she told me that she got switched out and went to a class that she wanted. I know people in that class still but its not the same because I knew we were going to lose our friendship because we would never see each other. Its a couple weeks into the last semester and we hardly ever talk sometimes it gets awkward just to be around her because its not like how it used to be. Laughter is how me and her became friends and classes is what tore us apart. Laughing together created a strong bond between us, but the separation caused by different classes led to a gradual drift in our friendship.

The mood was sweet and the room was warm with most of my family and friends, except for my brother. At the time, I was only about 4 or 5 years old. I was looking all around our two-story house trying to find my brother, but for some reason, this time it just seemed impossible. All I could hear in the background was my family laughing as this little 4 or 5-year-old ran full speed up and down hallways, opening and closing doors to rooms he had never been in before. He was shouting at the top of his lungs, "Where are you? I can't find you!"  With one more door to open at the beginning of the hallway where everyone was gathered, this little boy came running down the hall in a panic. He couldn't find his brother. He opened the door, and out popped his brother, wearing a scary monster mask, saying, "I will get you tonight if you don't eat all your dinner." So, I did just as he told me to do. I ate my dinner so fast that I ended up throwing up because I was so scared that he was going to come after me that night!  This continued for the rest of the night, with me eating quickly out of fear. It was a funny and memorable experience that I will never forget.

Laughter is undeniably important in life, relationships, and overall well-being. It has the power to connect people, improve communication, and bring joy to everyday interactions. Being with someone who can make you laugh is a gift, as it lightens the mood and strengthens the connection between partners. The ability to share laughter and find joy in each other's company is essential for a fulfilling relationship. Ultimately, laughter plays a vital role in bringing happiness and positivity into our lives, making it a precious and irreplaceable aspect of human interaction.

Hi, my name is @CAPS1. I am just an ordinary girl with a story like every other girl. I'm writing this because this story means something to me and I would like to share it. Honestly, I depend on a good laugh during my day. Without laughter, life would never be the same for me. Laughing has brought me to who I am today. Not only has it made me the person I am, but it has brought me to all my friends and the people I love. For example, I use laughter between me and my boyfriend @PERSON1. @PERSON1 and I are just like any other couple. We have fun, do stuff together, and we argue. The worst part is when we fight. Just like everyone else, we have hard times and good times. Our hard times always start when we wake up. When I wake up, it's still really dark outside. The smell of fresh morning air makes me feel refreshed. I always feel like the happiest girl in the world. A little while after I wake up, I text @PERSON1 good morning, and we usually talk throughout the day. Sometimes he comes to see me, or I just see him at school. When I see him, I am happy and my toes curl. We will go for a walk and talk about everything and anything, just life. At this point, he thinks it's time to say something funny. So he does, he will make fun of how I look, what I am wearing, and what I say. He doesn't find it hurtful, but to me, it is. Many times I might even say something mean back, which doesn't help, it just makes it worse. Not long goes by, maybe a few seconds, and we start to fight. He doesn't understand he has hurt me or he doesn't care. He tells me he has done nothing wrong. So I try to explain, and he doesn't listen. I just stop trying, and if he realizes how he hurt me or what happened that bothered me, that's fine, but I am not going to fight anymore, so I just stop explaining things. Enough has gone through my mind, so I cry, and he gives me a dumb look. This just makes everything worse, so of course our fight breaks out and gets even worse. There is yelling and screaming with tears and mean, rotten words tossed all over the place; it's a mess. I usually storm off in the middle of it because I can't take any more. Finally, time goes by, and we haven't talked all day. We don't have anything to say to each other. Eventually, someone gets the nerve to talk or say something to another. Still, each of us is on edge, so I say something stupid or funny to lighten the mood. I will do anything to see a smile on his face, even if we have done each other wrong, I still love him and can't stand for it to be like this anymore. Of course, he smiles, just what I was looking for; this makes me happy and laugh. He will then ask for a hug, and so he hugs me even if I don't answer or if I say no, it doesn't matter to him. He apologizes and explains a couple of things to me. I feel bad because I hate the stress and the fight, so we work it out. Now you can see if I didn't have laughter, I might be depressed. Without laughter, things would be harder and more complicated. But a good laugh or a simple joke can ease things and make them a lot better in life. I just want people to understand what a small laugh can do to your day. If it can change your day in such a big way, then it can change your life in a major way. Things may come across as hard or rough. When I look back on my life and see what it has done to me and for me, I realize I laughed at something each one of those days even though I was down, and it brought me back up again. Laughing truly is the best medicine, and it has the power to heal even the toughest of situations.

Laughter is an essential component of any relationship, as it can brighten someone's day and provide much-needed support during difficult times. When we see someone struggling or feeling down, a simple act of kindness such as sharing a smile or a joke can make a significant difference in their day. By offering a listening ear and a shoulder to lean on, we can help others navigate through their challenges and find comfort in knowing that they are not alone. I once witnessed the power of spreading happiness and laughter to someone in need, and it taught me the importance of being there for others during their darkest moments. It is crucial to offer support, love, and laughter to those who are facing tough times, as it can truly make a positive impact on their well-being. So, let us always be ready to spread happiness and laughter to those who need it most, for it is through these simple acts of kindness that we can truly make a difference in someone's life.

Building the bond with Laughter From a very early age, my uncle introduced me and my brothers to the joy of funny cards on our birthdays, just to see our reactions. Even when he moved closer to us on the west coast, we continued to tease each other to lighten the mood. We developed a keen sense of knowing when one of us was having a rough day and how to bring a smile back to their face. As we celebrated birthdays together in our hometown, the tradition of exchanging humorous cards continued, bringing endless laughter and joy to our gatherings.   When my uncle relocated to a new city, my older brother and I carried on the tradition of finding the most amusing cards to surprise him with on his special day. Our competition escalated, leading to cards with outrageous jokes and cheeky humor that never failed to elicit a chuckle. Despite working in the same building but in different roles, our daily interactions always involved humor and lighthearted banter. Whether he was stressed or in high spirits, our exchanges never failed to lift each other's spirits and bring a sense of camaraderie to the workplace.  Our shared love for adventure led us to purchase season passes to Mount Hood, where our skiing and snowboarding escapades became yet another opportunity for laughter and friendly competition. Initially struggling on the slopes, I eventually surpassed my uncle's skills, turning the tables and reveling in the chance to tease him good-naturedly. The roles reversed as he faced a string of falls, allowing me to playfully poke fun at his expense and savor the sweet taste of payback.  Through his influence, my uncle has instilled in me a deep appreciation for laughter and the ability to find humor even in challenging situations. Our bond has evolved from a traditional uncle-nephew relationship to that of close friends, built on a foundation of shared jokes and joyful moments. His presence in my life has not only brought endless laughter but also shaped my outlook on life, filling each day with warmth and happiness. I am grateful for the laughter he has brought into my life and look forward to a future filled with shared moments of joy and humor.

Despite the headache, we all shared a moment of laughter before drifting off to sleep. Looking back on this day, we still cherish the memories and the laughter shared with our loved ones.

Laughter, what is the meaning; to show mirth, joy, or scorn with a chuckle or explosive vocal sound. People without laughter in their life go through stages of depression or feel a sadness inside them; they never seem to be able to find the light at the end of the tunnel, "the light being happiness." The days turn into months or even years, life seems to be at a standstill. When you feel there is no happiness you begin to have doubts on your decisions in life; the choices you have made in life seem to all be wrong. This is what my life felt like when the world turned around and I found out my best friend just flipped her car. I was traumatized, in shock; I didn't know so many things could rush through your head in that given moment. I instantly started to ask a million questions to see if she was okay. All they could share with me at the time was that she was being rushed to the hospital. All I could do once I got home was lay in my bed and think; what could I have done so she would not have been in that car-- all I felt was guilt! That night was wretched my mind just kept wrapping around all the times my best friend and I spent together, the laughter we shared between each other, stupid fights, and all the dumb pranks. What was eating at me most though was we had gotten in a fight not too long before she wrecked; the worst part was it was over the stupidest thing. I had got irritated at her for constantly ditching out on our plans we had together to go spend time with her boyfriend. Now that I look back at it, all I felt was jealousy. If only I could take it all back, then maybe she would not have been distracted while she was driving and missed her turn. That next morning her mother called me and said "she is asking for you, you come to the hospital and see her if you please." I was ecstatic, I got ready faster than I ever have before; within a few minutes I was ready and in my pick-up driving myself to the hospital. It only took me thirty-five minutes to get there, when it should take you around forty-five. I instantly jumped out of my truck, rushed into the hospital and went to the check-in desk to see what room she would be in. They told me she was in room right down the hall on the left. I got to the room, there was a crack in the door so I peeked in before trying to open the door the rest of the way; I finally got the confidence to open the door and go talk to her. She instantly had a smile on her face when she saw me, I pulled up a chair and sat right next to her. We talked for about an hour just about random things; including the wreck. She told me she had a few broken ribs and a minor concussion, so she should be able to be out by that afternoon. When she told me that, I was one of the happiest people right at that moment. All I could do was laugh when she told me everything was fine; almost like laughter of relief. It did not take long before both of us started laughing, most of it was out of excitement and having nothing else to say; except the beautiful sound of laughter coming out of our mouths. I have to say it felt good just to be by my friend's side again being able to share happy moments with each other. So what is the meaning of Laughter to me; shall you ask? It is the most meaningful thing that anyone could possibly do. Laughter is to show signs of happiness, a giggle or an outburst; sharing unforgettable moments with a loved one. Without laughter, your life cannot be complete, make jokes, just laugh make life have meaning again. Do not go through life being sad, instead be happy. Go ahead test it out and see what laughter can do for you in your life!

Throughout my whole life, I've always been someone who finds joy in existence, even after facing challenges like falling through a metal roof. Growing up in a low-income household with a single mother and two siblings was tough, but I made it through with the help of my best friend, who was like family to me. My mother's best friend and her daughter became our family, and even though they left for a while, our bond remained strong. When I had a mishap and met a cute boy on the way to get help, laughter helped us cope with the situation and brought us closer together. No matter the circumstances, laughter has the power to heal, connect people, and make tough times a little bit easier. Laughing together with my cousin reminded me that even in difficult moments, finding joy can make a world of difference.

Warm laughter is not only the best medicine but also the best glue in relationships. When we laugh with others, we share a sense of relaxation and happiness that brings us closer together. Laughter is a release from overthinking, allowing us to open up and connect with one another on a deeper level. Flirting, often involving humor and light-heartedness, can lead to laughter and a stronger bond between individuals.   I experienced this firsthand in my relationship with my girlfriend. After a painful experience with someone else, I had closed myself off emotionally. However, my girlfriend's kindness and humor helped me to let my guard down and laugh freely with her. Our shared laughter has been a cornerstone of our two-year relationship, creating a comfortable and joyful atmosphere for us to grow together.  Being able to laugh at oneself is key to building strong relationships. By being open, compassionate, and willing to be a little silly, we can connect with others on a deeper level. Laughter is a powerful tool for social bonding, breaking down barriers, and creating a warm and inviting atmosphere.   In social gatherings, laughter plays a crucial role in bringing people together and creating a sense of comfort and relaxation. Just like warm honey, laughter is easy to spread and mix with other ingredients, making it a versatile and essential element in fostering strong relationships.  My relationship, built on a foundation of laughter and warmth, has been incredibly fulfilling and rewarding. By making each other laugh, we have strengthened our bond and created a space where we can be ourselves fully. Laughter truly is the best glue, holding us together through challenges and moments of joy.

The Importance and Benefits of Laughter   Laughter is an essential element in life that can lighten moods and bring happiness. Children tend to laugh more easily, while adults often struggle to find reasons to laugh due to their serious nature. However, laughter has the power to connect with other positive emotions like joy and happiness. In a story about a girl named Lily, her ability to bring gladness to others through laughter led to improved health and overall well-being.   On a gloomy day, Lily's household was filled with grumpiness and discontent. Despite her own bad mood, Lily decided to bring laughter and cheer to her family and school. Inspired by a story about a simple orphan girl who spread happiness wherever she went, Lily realized the power of laughter in brightening people's lives. By spreading joy and laughter, Lily transformed her home and school into happier places, even on the darkest days.  Through Lily's example, we learn that laughter is a simple yet powerful tool for improving our lives and the lives of those around us. By choosing to laugh and spread happiness, we can create a more positive and joyful environment for ourselves and others. Laughter truly is the best medicine, and its effects can be felt in every aspect of our lives.

It was the first day of sophomore year. I had just moved to a new town during the summer so I was nervous about the new school just like any kid would be. I walked into the school and checked out my surroundings. Everything seemed normal enough until I saw it. Near the middle of the sea of tables in the cafeteria was about four tables with around ten people at each one, but it wasn't the fact that they were there that caught my attention it was what they were doing. They were dueling with Yu-Gi-Oh! cards right there in the middle of the cafeteria where all could see! I was baffled, I mean I used to duel when I was younger in elementary school when the game was newer, but I had to quit cause everyone in my old school stopped dueling, and here I am looking at at least twenty high schoolers just dueling away. What surprised me most of all was that they were right there in the open where everyone could see, and worst of all judge. I moved to a table nearby them and began to watch a kid named Joey (who later has become one of my best friends) mop the floor with his opponent. I quickly caught back on to most of the rules, and went home that day thinking "I'm gonna get back into that game!". So I bought a deck, and continued my recon of the tables, my deck sitting in front of me waiting for someone to challenge its master. A few days went by as I continued my silent observation of the duelists. Finally a duelist named Kaiba (another one of my now good friends) challenged me. I accepted and began. He then proceeded to thoroughly kick my butt in the space of what seemed like five rounds into the game. Joey then taught me how to play better and we became best friends. He is a really funny guy, and to this day I cant hang around him without laughing. Through him I have met tons of great friends. Even now I wonder what my high school life would be like if they didn't attend my new school.

Laughter is essential in any relationship, as it has the power to lighten up the mood in just a few seconds. Whether it's because something is funny or simply out of tiredness, sharing laughter with loved ones can create unforgettable moments. One of the best memories I have of laughing with my cousin happened in a store. We had a hilarious time playing a prank on our friend, pretending to be ninjas and hiding from her while she searched for us. The joy and laughter we shared during that silly moment are just one example of how laughter can bring people closer together and create lasting bonds.

One day I woke up staring out my window and was listening to the birds chirp outside. I usually leave my window open to sleep with fresh air because I hate breathing in my own breath; it's too warm. As I woke up, I walked out and ate some rice crispy treats with my two sisters. I was late for school, so I quickly got dressed and urged my sisters to hurry up and get ready. My sister in second grade and my other sister in third grade took their time with makeup and hair, as girls usually do. Our schools were next to each other, so we headed off to school, ready for the day with my teacher, Ms. Hawk.  Ms. Hawk wasn't the nicest teacher, but I enjoyed her class because she made learning fun. We started the day with a book about ghouls and monsters, which she read in a captivating way. Math followed, and she always challenged me with harder problems, saying I was different. After school, I tried to find my sister to walk home together, but she hurried off with her friends, leaving me behind.  My dad was waiting in the car, and as I rushed to reach it, a speeding car came dangerously close to hitting me. I was hit and left bruised, but thankfully nothing was serious. My dad rushed me home and then to the hospital, where they assured me I would recover but might have trouble with sports due to a fractured hip. Despite the injury, my family pampered me with treats, and I returned to school the next day, albeit limping.  When my teacher accused me of faking my injury, my mom intervened, and the lady who hit me ended up covering my medical expenses. It was a tough experience, but I was grateful for the support of my family and the consequences faced by the reckless driver.

My knees were weak and my hands were slightly shaking as my rapid heartbeat was causing my breathing to increase speed and time. I wanted to get this over with, but at the same time, I hadn't the intentions to ever start a conversation, yet alone, approach him. It had been a whole year since I had seen my dad and I wasn't sure whether to expect a relaxed, laid back man, or an uptight, cranky one. So, I closed my eyes, took deep breaths, and decided to put this in the hands of fate. It was obvious that once I saw my dad, it would be a natural thing to talk to him, but I was suspicious of his mood and if it would affect mine at all. If for any reason this did happen for the worse, we probably wouldn't be the best of friends for a matter of weeks. He'd then continue to pull the, "Do you think now that you're a teenager, you can do and act however you want?" Or the, "I'm your father, I deserve more respect!" The funny thing is, I never start any of these things. He chooses to start them when he's bored, I guess. Then, he continues to make me feel bad for his wrongdoings.  When my mother, sister, and I arrived at the airport, I (I'm not going to lie) wanted to go home. My sister would crack a few jokes here and there and my mother would let her wittiness shine on me; even in the midst of all of this, they could only get a small giggle out of me because I let my nerves get the best of me. I didn't want my past three months to be ruined by his coming home. But once I looked back at all I had done: two weeks in Europe, rafting, etc., I realized that I did miss him and did want him back. Don't get me wrong, my dad is a super nice, funny, and hardworking guy, it's just hard to work with him sometimes.  My dad's flight had landed, and after a solid hour of waiting for him, he came out of the airplane. We could see his eyes frantically scouring the airport for us, and when he found us, he gave the warmest, friendliest smile I had ever seen upon his face. Tears welled up in his eyes as my sister raced for him and my mom quickly walked behind. My legs carried me toward him, and I soon found that my sister and I were competing to be the first to hug him! One hundred feet never felt so close yet so far away. Panting, we reached him with heavy legs and full hearts, now that we were with him.  The good thing is, an awkward moment never appeared. It knocked, but we didn't let it come through the door; instead, laughter came in its place. All of my troubles and worries were gone when he opened his mouth, and those soothing waves of laughter came out and were welcomed into our ears. My heart was lifted, and my smile brightened. I knew that my father could not have been gone any longer. I love him! Laughter soothes the soul and brings joy to any situation. It is kind and has no regrets. The only mistake is not taking the chance to laugh in the first place. Laughter is one of the many things that holds me so close to my father today. Our sense of humor when we're together is never dull and is unforgettable. I trust him with my life and ever since I was born, he has found a way to make the best out of every situation by laughter. I can count on his laugh to make anyone smile, and it is without a doubt, the most contagious thing I'll ever hear.  "Laughter is the shortest distance between two people," including me and my father.

The first day I met her, I knew @CAPS4 was the right dog for me. Her black and white fur was as soft as cotton, and her eyes as brown as the bark on a tree. @CAPS4 had a genuine personality no other dog could possess. Which was something I could tell right away @CAPS4 was the dog for me. Over the next couple of months, our friendship grew, as I taught her to talk, smile, and stand on two legs and dance with me. A black lab @PERSON1, instantly became her best friend, as the two ran over the property barking and playing. Every night the two would cuddle up next to each other and sleep. The times @CAPS1 (my new dog) would lay on her side and relax, I would call her an oreo. Her middle belly was white and her sides were black, making her look like a large-breathing oreo @CAPS1. @CAPS5 her name had come from. The seventh month had come along fast, but it was enjoyable every day with my @CAPS1 at my side. @CAPS4 gave me the best comfort when I needed it, always giving me a smile when the day was rainy, or sleeping next to me when I didn't feel the best. It was kind of like @CAPS4 was my own special dose of medicine, her presence made me feel well again. Her love had grown deep into all of our hearts at that house, and @CAPS4 was one of a kind, but something began to change about her as the days went on. Her food bowl would be nearly full every time we fed her, @CAPS4 wouldn't run with @PERSON1 anymore, @CAPS4 wouldn't talk, and @CAPS4 wouldn't smile. I knew something was wrong. We didn't know @CAPS4 was sick until it was too late. The first day @CAPS4 had thrown up blood. That was when the worrying began between my boyfriend, his mother, and I. We wanted to find a vet to help her, but none of us had the money to do it. The second day in the @TIME1, I couldn't find @CAPS1 anywhere on the property. I thought that maybe @CAPS4 had just gone for a walk around the outskirts of the house, until it reached @NUM1 pm and there was still no sign of her. Panic spread throughout my body, and I gave up looking for her and turned towards @PERSON1. "@PERSON1," I looked at her straight into her eyes, "I know you can hear me." @CAPS4 looked at me with big brown eyes and wagged her tail. "@CAPS5 is @CAPS1, @PERSON1?" I knew @CAPS4 understood me as @CAPS4 began to sniff around the areas of the property and suddenly as if @CAPS4 had picked up a trace, had followed a line of scent to an old opal car. @PERSON1 wagged her tail looked at me and looked back under the car. There @CAPS1 was sick looking. So I pulled her back up onto the property for my boyfriend's mother to look at her. We weren't sure if it was poisoning or something else. So we called an animal expert and asked. @CAPS4 said it sounded most likely like parvo, since we hadn't gotten @CAPS1 her parvo shot yet. So over the night to help her feel better, I and my boyfriend stayed up shooting water into her dehydrated body, and spinach juice hoping it would help, but all @CAPS4 wanted to do was sleep. So we left her alone in peace and decided we would check up on her in the @TIME1. In the @TIME1, my boyfriend had to go to work, and I was left alone with @CAPS1 to take care of her. I sang songs to her as @CAPS4 laid on the porch sad looking and in despair, I stroked her on her head telling her how much @CAPS4 was my best friend and my favorite dog that meant so much to me, and I told her I loved her. I tried getting her to eat, but @CAPS4 would only puke it back up. Finally, after a day of crying next to her, I noticed @CAPS4 kept walking to the pond behind the house and sitting in it. It gave me the incentive to check her butt. As I pulled up her tail, I noticed a large bloody hole @CAPS5 flies were flying out of. @CAPS4 was rotting from the inside out. I cried. It was time to decide whether to put her down or not, and I, my boyfriend, and his father just looked at her watching

Fishing has always been a significant part of my life, starting from my childhood days spent fishing with my dad and brother at the lakes. As I grew older, my trusty fishing pole began to show signs of wear and tear, leading me to save up money to buy a new one for my tenth birthday. Equipped with my new fishing pole, I eagerly joined my dad for a fishing trip to a river after attending a family wedding. However, a comical mishap occurred when a flock of birds swooped down and carried my new fishing pole away, causing it to land in the middle of the river. Despite the unexpected turn of events, we managed to retrieve the pole downriver, and the incident became a memorable fishing tale shared between my dad and me.

@DATE1 my birthday, my boyfriend @PERSON2 took me to @LOCATION1 to @ORGANIZATION2's. I had never been there it was exciting and a new food experience for me. My dad had promised me that he would take me because it was my @NUM1 birthday and he wasn't there for my @NUM2 birthday. But he forgot so my dad's girlfriend called the restaurant and told the manager that it was my birthday and to give me anything that I wanted and just to charge it on her credit card. This is where mine and @PERSON2's adventure started. The beginning of our adventure. Driving on the old back roads of @CAPS1 in the old @ORGANIZATION1 on our way to @LOCATION1. Just @PERSON2 and I, the roads were damp with the mid-afternoon dew, the trees with their beautiful leaves of all different colors of reds, greens, and oranges. Bouncing around from the dips in the old road. @NUM3 bumping on the stereo, only singing the parts we know. When we got to @CAPS2 we got lost because we took the wrong exit and ended up in @LOCATION2, the other side of where we were supposed to be. Being lost in a way bigger city than @PERSON1 or @CAPS1 wasn't good, we had no clue where we were. First place we went to was a strip mall that had a big party store. We went inside and there were decorations as far as the eye could see - monsters, witches, and goblins. We got sidetracked by all the scary things, but then I realized that I had to go to the bathroom. While I went to the bathroom, @PERSON2 asked one of the store clerks where we could find this @CAPS5. The guy said he had never heard of a place like that. So we got back into the @ORGANIZATION1, there was a lady getting out of her car so we asked her. She said yeah, it's just down a couple of streets. As we drove down the highway, we couldn't find it anywhere. Somehow we were lost all over again, so we found another convenient store up this really big hill. We didn't think that the little @ORGANIZATION1 could make it up such a big hill. We made it to the top, went inside, and had the clerk look up on his phone where we needed to go. As we waited, all I could think about was how bad my feet were hurting in those shoes. We got the address and took off again for our search. About twenty minutes later, we still had no luck at finding this restaurant and to top it off we had a reservation so we couldn't be late. We found another convenient store and @PERSON2 ran in to ask. The clerk told us to get back on the highway but I insisted we stay on the current road. We followed the empty road and right around the corner, there it was @CAPS5. We were happy to have found it finally and we weren't even late. All @PERSON2 and I could do was laugh because we had gotten so frustrated to find the stupid place that it was just so funny you couldn't help but not to laugh. It brought @PERSON2 and I just that much closer, we had gotten through that by laughing instead of fighting. And that was our funny adventure story.

Ever since I was born laughter has been a big part of my life without it I would be a very boring and grumpy person. Even tough I have experienced many moments full of laughter one specific moment always comes to mind. About a year ago my mom and I went on a trip down to @LOCATION1 to visit her family. It was the first time we had been there in over twelve years because my mom and I could not go visit them do to immigration problems. After all toughs years had past by my mom and I managed to get our legal residency in the united states. As soon as we got the residency we were free and could go visit her family without having to come back illegally. When my mom and I got to the airport in @LOCATION1 my mom started crying because she was full of emotions, for the first time in twelve years she was going to see her mom, dad, brothers, and sisters. As soon as we had gone trough all the airport security and baggage claim we made our way out to the exit where my grandpa had agreed to pick us up. When we got outside the airport a small little red @ORGANIZATION1 started getting closer and closer driving towards my mom and I. The car was no further then forty feet away when my mom suddenly dropped her luggage and started running toward the small red car I had no idea who the elderly person driving the car was. When the car parked an aged man stepped out of the vehicle and gave my mom one of the longest and most emotional hugs I had ever experienced in my entire life they must of been hugging for at least fifteen minutes just crying on each-others shoulders. When they had finished hugging my mom calls out my name and I start walking toward her. When I was face to face with my mom and the older man my mom tells me that the man was my grandfather then she looks at her dad and tells him to meet his grandson. For the first time in a very long time I had a grandfather I stood in shock for a while and so did he. He was amazed of how big and how much I had changed in toughs long twelve years that he had gone without seeing me or having contact with me. When I reached out to hug him he griped me hard and didn't let go he told me that this day had been the happiest day of his life.  Me and my grandpa started loading the luggage into his car so we could head home to meet the rest of my family. When we got done loading everything into the car we headed home. The long ride home was a bit weird and uncomfortable because there wasn't much talk in the car. It was about a fifty minute ride home when we reached our destination in a small little town out of the @LOCATION1 called texcoco. It was a nice little clean town with a lot of small stores and lots of two story middle class houses the streets full of cars and people walking or on bicycles very different to what I was used to back in the united states. When we got to our house there was a group of about twenty people that were family and friends outside the gate waiting for us. When we were done seedling in and got done meeting all our relatives we got together and had a family dinner. One of my uncles really stood out because he was really funny and always was acting like a clown he was the one that set the mood in the house or wherever he went. As days past by I was getting more and more comfortable with the people around me and started having fun. About two weeks past and my uncle @CAPS1 invited me to one of his stand up comedy shows. that day I experienced more laughter then ever before his jokes where original and true. In conclusion, laughter is one of the elements to life without I could not be happy.

It's my sophomore year and some of my friends were going to try out softball. After thinking about it, I joined, and I fell in love with this sport. I am not that good, but like they say, practice makes perfect. We all laugh and have a good time, and everyone likes everyone. It's fun to be a part of a team that is always laughing and having a great time together. This is about a time when my friends and I started laughing so hard we almost started crying, and now it's one of our little jokes between all of us girls.  Once my friends and I were out catching pop fly's, and it was my turn to go catch the ball. I went out there skipping and just being my normal weird self. They hit the ball, and it started to come towards me. I went running for it and slipped and fell right on my butt. Everyone, including me, started laughing because I fell in the mud and got all dirty. About ten minutes later, we were all standing there and talking about how funny it was when I fell and how it made everyone's day. Then I saw some mud on the ground and I wanted to roll in it, but didn't want to just lay down and start rolling in mud. So I asked my friend to push me into the mud so I could fall in and roll in it. After she pushed me into the mud, I got up and started laughing my head off. My knees were covered in mud, and so was my butt and legs. They all started to say, "Who shied on you?" because we are not allowed to curse, so we made something else to replace it.  Now when I walk in the hallways and see someone from the softball team, we both just start laughing and say, "Who shied on you?" in the middle of whatever we are doing right then. This is the first year I have ever played a sport in high school, and I am glad I did it because I am having so much fun. When it ends in a few months, I am going to be really upset. All these girls and I have become so close in the last few weeks that they are like family to me now. Most of us used to just know each other and not really be friends or talk at all, but now we all do. We love to do silly things like sing in the locker room randomly or make the dumbest jokes ever. But we all have fun, and we don't care. We have had lots of laughs and many more to come this season, like when we have games on the buses or even at practice.  We have an amazing coach that makes us laugh and makes jokes every day. This season should be interesting with all of us because we all like to laugh, make jokes, sing, and just have a great time with each other. That's all that matters to make a good softball team and a great season.

The Benefits of Laughter  Laughter has always been a major part of my life. Most of the relationships that I have with my friends are great, because I can make them laugh and cheer them up when they feel down. When a person laughs, it makes them completely forget about anything that brought them down, and now they just focus on what made them laugh and feel that joy and happiness. When you laugh, the only thing on your mind is the thing that made you laugh, nothing else.  Laughter, in many cases, has brought people from an absolute low self-esteem to a high self-esteem in a very short amount of time. An example where laughter was very beneficial to a person happened with one of my friends. One of my good friends seemed to be really down and didn't want to talk about what was going on with anyone. With him not telling anyone what was wrong, it kind of leaves you guessing, what could have happened?  After about a week of pretty much isolating himself from others, he was ready to talk and hang out with some of his close friends, which included me. Me, and two other people that were friends with me and him, decided to go golfing, which was a new hobby of ours. It was that day that he told us how his mom was cheating on his dad for over a year, and how she was also hiding alcohol in all different kinds of places and was over-drinking.  By him just being around his friends, laughing and having a good time, he found himself focusing on other things other than what was going wrong in his life. Even laughing at yourself can be a good way of coping with your problems. Even when there seems that nothing will go right in your life, something always will, you just have to give it time.  The moral of the story that I have just told is that no matter how sad you feel, laughter can always help ease the pain. Even laughing about a bad situation could help you to feel better. Remember, laughter is truly the best medicine.

Laughter is a significant aspect of human life, serving as a means to express various emotions and connect with others. It plays a crucial role in forming bonds, breaking down barriers, and creating a sense of camaraderie. Personal experiences with laughter, such as sharing jokes with friends and family, can strengthen relationships and create lasting memories. However, while laughter is generally positive, it can also have negative implications when used inappropriately, such as when mocking others or encouraging harmful behaviors. Overall, laughter is a powerful tool that can bring joy, foster connections, and uplift spirits, but it should be wielded with care and sensitivity to avoid causing harm.

So my friends and I got into a heated discussion on how we need to keep things to ourselves because one of my friends told people some personal things about us. He caused us a lot of problems in school and around town. He started to lie to us, and one of my other friends lost it and went after him, tackling him down and telling him to quit lying. After he let him up and we all got back in our seats, he started to spill his guts to us, confessing the rumors he started about us and other things he did. We all kind of lost it. After calming down a bit, we took turns talking to him. When it was my turn, he kept interrupting me, and I finally got mad and grabbed something off the floor to throw at him. I reached down, picked up something soft without looking, and threatened to throw it at him. He started to point and laugh, and I turned my head to see what was in my hand. It was a stuffed fairy from his floor. I couldn't help but laugh and playfully threw it at him. The laughter helped to ease the tension and make things better for him and all of us. The moral of the story is that even when you're mad, something will always make you smile and make your day better.

Every fiber of my being was urging me to talk to her, but my gut churned with anxiety every time I gathered up the courage to do so. Then she glanced at me. Just for a second, but enough to gather information about me. Enough to tell that I wasn't just looking around the room vacantly, but I was focusing on her dark brown eyes, and hers only. I sheepishly flickered my eyes away, quickly counseling myself, why did you keep looking at her? You knew that she was going to notice! But somehow I knew I wanted her to. I wanted her to look back at me. I didn't feeling her gaze upon me anymore, even though it was only a second before that we made eye contact. I darted my eyes in her direction again. This time she was looking at me first and I fell into her sight. I didn't know what to do about this, I haven't been in this situation before. No girl has ever beaten me to first glance. She smiled, a cute little smile, I've noticed you noticing me, I don't see why you need to hide it. I have my eye on you. All I could do was focus on not looking like a moron. I willed myself to smile, but only slightly, enough to let her know I saw her smile, and it was at me! There was she, smiling at me, giving me a chance to show her what makes me a guy for her. Then the day came. The ice rink in our town was about 20 minutes away, which seemed short because of the four friends that were howling and talking crap about each other in the back. We drove up and parked next to the rink. As we stepped out of my mom's minivan we could all hear the hustle and bustle of kids strapping on their rental skates and awkwardly walking towards the thick glass doors that lead to the oval arena of dry frigid air accompanied by a thick bed of cut up ice. Our group of friends all traded in our money and received our own pair of worn, probably never cleaned, ice skates. Absently we slide on the uncomfortable bladed shoes and waddled for the glass doors. One-by-one each of us stepped cautiously onto the ice, making sure we didn't look silly by sliding forward and performing the splits in front of everyone around us. When we finally conquered that challenge we proceeded to slide our way along with the current of skaters flowing in the counterclockwise loop around the rink. Every once in a while we'd race each other for a lap around the rink, but besides that we just talked about our game of choice: Overwatch and the various other games that held our interest. But as usual, that conversation turned into a debate about "overpowered classes". One side complaining that they can never win against that class, the other saying that it's very easy to "destroy" them with a simple trick. I proceeded to daze off out of the fight, looking around the rink, watching people stumble along their path or glide gracefully through the awkwardly skating participants. Then I saw her again. Her hair was the first thing that caught my eye, it acting as a blanket would being hung on a clothesline out in a summer's breeze. Then as she looped around the end of the rink her face started to be revealed, just as beautiful as before. She wasn't having the hardest time skating, but every once in a while she would slide a skate too far to one side, lose her balance, but was able to regain her composure within a second or two. I smiled as she looked around, checking if anyone had seen her little mishap. "Ana the sniper is OP in Temple of Anubis, you don't know what you're talking about!" my friends sneered at one another. I had no interest in being pulled into this argument. As I sped up away from my friends, and weaved my way through the crowd, I eased my way towards her. As I approached her I was running one-liners through my head to use as an icebreaker with her. I noticed her feet slide outwards on both sides of her, and I smiled at what I could do to be able to engage her. As she began to stumble, I had to time my entry perfectly as to seem like a random bystander just there to help her back up, rather than an anxious boy trying to find a way to talk to her. Right when she was about to fall over I sped up and placed my hand on her back and gave her a little push upwards. But she was too far gone. She tumbled on top of me as we fell to the hard ice. As the commotion ceased, she quickly jumped off and apologized for her clumsiness. But all she noticed was my hysterical laughing. All

Laughter I have many friends. My friends and I are always doing silly things to have a good time, and pass the time. We are laughing all the time. There is not one day where we are together and we do not laugh. My friends and I believe that laughter is an essential element of life. One, blazing, @DATE1 day my friends, @PERSON2, @LOCATION3, @PERSON1, @LOCATION1, and @PERSON3 , all came over to my house. We were all bored, and hot, so we wanted to decide on something exciting to do. @LOCATION3 said, "@CAPS1 don't we go swimming you guy's?" We all agreed. My friends and I could not agree on where to go swimming though. We couldn't go to the pool near my house, because it was to crowded. We also, could not go to the lake, because it was too far, and we had no way to get there. My mother was working, so she could not give us a ride. @CAPS6 then said, "I know you guy's! @CAPS1 don't we just have a water balloon fight right here at @CAPS2's house?" We all responded, "@CAPS3 let's do it!" A little after, the @CAPS4 went to the store nearest by, which was @ORGANIZATION1, to buy water balloons, and water guns. Once they got back, they started filling them up right away. While us ladies changed into our bathing suits. After, we all decided on who was going to be on what team. The first team was @PERSON2, @PERSON3, and @LOCATION1. The second team, and the best team, was @LOCATION3, @PERSON1, and I. Both teams were all ready to go. Each team had buckets full of water balloons, and water guns. The teams were on different sides of my mom's green suburban. We were going to start throwing water balloons at the count of three, but the opposite team cheated and threw a water balloon before. Oh, but they did not realize that we had the hose on our side. @PERSON4 chased @PERSON1 across the yard. She caught up to her and soaked her with her water gun, but @PERSON1 threw a huge water balloon at her. It exploded right on her face. We all started laughing. Then, @PERSON2 and I started throwing water balloons at each other. We ran out, so we started using our water guns. Those too eventually ran out. @PERSON2 was all out of resources. I grabbed the hose, and I turned it up to full power. @PERSON2 tried to run but he slipped and fell. I completely hosed him down. My team had won the first @CAPS5. It was time for @CAPS5 two now. We had filled up more water balloons, refilled our water guns, and gone to our sides. We all counted, "One! Two! Three!" @CAPS5 two had started. @LOCATION3 started chasing @PERSON3. They went around the suburban at least five times before he caught up to her. He caught up to her on the grass. The grass was really slippery from when I got @CAPS6 wet, so they slipped, and fell down. @PERSON3 slipped first, but she took @LOCATION3 down with her when she was trying to get back up. We all started throwing water balloons at them, which made it harder for them to get up. @PERSON3 managed to get up she went on the side where her team was. They started throwing everything they had at us. They soaked us up. We had lost the second @CAPS5. Now it was time for the final @CAPS5. The @CAPS5 that decided who won, and who lost. We filled up double the water balloons, and double the water guns. No one got the hose that time. We thought it was not fair. Both teams lined up on different sides of my front yard. My team was on the right side, and the opposite team was on the left side. We were against who ever was lined up in front of us. I threw the first water balloon at @LOCATION1. Then @LOCATION3 threw at @PERSON2, and after @PERSON3 at @LOCATION2. Who ever moved out of line lost. @PERSON1 was the first to lose. @PERSON3 had thrown a big water balloon at her that knocked her out of line. We moved a step closer. It was now three against two. @LOCATION3 then water gunned @CAPS6 down. We walked another step closer. @PERSON4 and I were going back and forth at each other, but @PERSON4 had no more water balloons after a while and her water gun was empty

Well it all started with the day he came to the airport. Missing him so much hardly ever getting to see him or have him return your phone calls like a brother should, but it is always a blessing to see him and have him over for the holidays. It's amazing how he found time during the holiday season to come and visit us. It was well fortunate because now I didn't have to hear him complain all the time about how cold and wet it was out here. So it was pretty good, but because it was the holiday season, it was normally about the time I go out and hang out with my friends and girls. Now that I started talking to this really beautiful girl that lives right around the corner from my house, I was dying to go out and be with her. But since time was really short with him, I had to put my brother first before anything. But every chance I got, I left and sneaked away to go see her. She was so beautiful, so funny, she was perfect to me, it was like a dream. I would tell my brother all the time about her. He would always tell me that even if she was real, it was impossible for a girl to be like that.  It was the first day he spent the night, and everybody was so happy in the house. From the time we picked him up from the airport to the drive home, talking, making jokes about how much he had changed, how tight his clothes were. It was good, we even stopped at Burger-Ville to get a couple of burgers because the boy was so hungry all the time, non-stop eating. We shortly arrived home and the look on my little brother and sister's faces was priceless. Their mouths were open so wide, like they had just seen a god. They came running towards him, and he wasn't prepared for it, slowly putting his bags down by the door, he got tackled and overrun by a 1-year-old girl and a 2-year-old boy. It was funny seeing them so happy and excited; it was a surprise for them, as we were only supposed to get gas. Then, we sat down and talked all night, watched movies as a family, but like my family, nothing ever happens accordingly or on time.  You know when you're having fun and laughing, you don't want it to end. You forget about everything, let time go by, and keep on doing what you do. But as time catches up to you and you're running on low energy because you've been excited all day to see your brother and share stories, tell jokes, and laugh, you get sleepy and in need of some rest. You dream of food and girls, most of the time they are put together in one whole dream after dream. Then we woke up, had a great time, shared some laughs in the morning, cracking jokes non-stop, talking, hanging out. I got to take my brother to some parties of mine, which really scared my parents, but it was funny at the same time.  Before we left, my mom said, "Okay, we're letting you go out, don't get yourself into any trouble, alright? Your dad's going to be picking you up, so don't be acting stupid. Look after your brother, okay?" And right after I said, "Yeah, alright, bet," I questioned it and thought, "Why do I have to look after my brother? He should be looking out for me." But I guess that's what made it funny. Ever since then, we had a good time, and that's where this story ends, with me saying goodbye to him at the airport, hoping that one day soon, I'll see him again soon.

Laughter is indeed a powerful tool in various aspects of life, especially in relationships. It serves as a bonding agent between partners, creating a sense of unity and shared joy. Being able to laugh together not only strengthens the emotional connection but also lightens the mood during difficult times. In times of sadness or stress, a good laugh can work wonders in lifting one's spirits and providing a momentary escape from negativity. Laughter is not just beneficial on a personal level; it can also contribute to a more harmonious society by promoting understanding, reducing conflicts, and fostering a sense of community. Ultimately, incorporating laughter into our lives can have far-reaching benefits, enhancing our relationships, well-being, and overall quality of life.

Most of the time when you are laughing about something you are with someone else. I believe that laughter brings two people closer because it's something you guys both share, a moment you and that other person can think of and picture over and over again in the future. Even if that person is miles away. I can remember it as if it just happened a couple weeks ago. I had just finished a conversation with @CAPS3 mom. I went into @CAPS3 room and unplugged @CAPS3 little black phone from the charger. I opened it and a blinking light flickered saying "@NUM1 missed calls from @PERSON1." I called her back to apologize for missing her phone call. I heard someone pick up, but nobody talked on the other end. " @CAPS1, @PERSON1 you there?" I had asked hoping I would get a reply out of her. I sure got a reply just not the one I was wanting. She started bawling. Trying to catch her breathe, the words barely escaping her mouth. "@CAPS2, @CAPS3 grandpa just died."  @CAPS3 heart sank into @CAPS3 stomach. @CAPS3 eyes started to water up and @CAPS3 throat started to close, making it harder to breathe. @CAPS3 voice was all shaky and rough. I said, "I'm sorry @PERSON1." and I started crying. Us both crying wasn't make anything better anytime soon. She then had explained that he had a heart attack and asked me how something could happen to someone that didn't deserve it. I didn't have an answer to give her though. I had never been in the position she was in. Who was I to know what to say, or do to help her? So I thought hard of what to say to her that would clear her mind a little bit. @CAPS3 brain started hurting when I finally found something from the heart to tell her, something I would want to hear if @CAPS3 grandpa passed away.  I said in a low calming voice, "there isn't much I can tell you because I don't know from experience, but you're family needs you right now as much as you need them. Think about the good times you had with you're grandpa @CAPS4. The laughs you guys enjoyed together. I heard a slight giggle underneath her sniffling. She started telling me a story about how every year her family would take a weekend beach trip. How it was a time for her family to bond and how she would miss it. When she told me that story @CAPS3 heart warmed and the corners of @CAPS3 mouth went up a little. I was proud of myself for sticking in there and being strong for @CAPS3 friend. Even though @PERSON1 will never see her grandpa @CAPS4 again she will always have him with her. Through memories, with in her heart, and by laughter.

Laughter is one of the most amazing things that the human body is able to do. The sound of laughter is as unique as the sound of crying. There are many things that can cause people to laugh. And once you start laughing, you can't stop. Laughter is caused by something that is humorous, so it's mostly the cause of laughter that makes it so much more fun. And it usually depends on who you are with, where you are, and in what kind of situation you're in before you can actually start laughing. Kind of like the time when I was in @LOCATION2 baking a pie with my @CAPS1 @CAPS2. It was a nice warm evening in @LOCATION2, and I was making a pie with my @CAPS1 @CAPS2. We had out all the ingredients necessary to make the pie until my @CAPS1 points out there's no more sugar. She tells me to go to the covers and grab a jar of sugar. So I went, and there were two jars when I opened the covers I asked her which of the two jars is the sugar because they had no labels on them. "I think it's the jar on the left," she said. I grab the jar on the left side without another word. Later on while everyone was sitting down talking with one another, my @CAPS1 and I go and get the pie to serve to the family. They all looked at the pie in awe as we took it out and started slicing it. After everyone was served they all took a bite out of it. Immediately in just seconds everybody starts spitting it out like it was the worst thing that they have ever put in their mouths. Suddenly my @LOCATION1 makes a comment saying that the pie is too salty, not exactly the kind of comment I was expecting. Then my @CAPS1 @CAPS2 goes and checks to see the jar that I had grabbed from the covers. She sticks her finger in the jar and tastes it. Luckily enough, it was the salt jar. Then out of nowhere everyone starts to laugh into tears at the thought of what just happened. It was the most fun I had that evening, nobody could stop laughing. Clearly, the situation with the pie was something that I will surely never forget, and it'll probably never happen again. And after all that happened with the pie ended up being the kind of situation that makes you laugh. This shows that the three causes of laughter are real. First, I was with my @CAPS1. Secondly, I was in my @LOCATION1's house where there has to be at least one funny thing that can happen there. And also what happened with the salt and the sugar was a completely unexpected situation that turned out to be unmistakably hilarious. And to think that this event happened all because of the three main causes of laughter. Laughter is one of the most amazing things that the human body is able to do. Laughter will always be one of those things in life that cannot ever be destroyed. If you are a person who says that they've never laughed, then you are a liar and a hypocrite. Being able to laugh is good for you and your health. It gives you extra oxygen in your lungs to help you breathe easier and it's a lot of fun. So if you ever notice that you haven't laughed, stop immediately and take the time to have a laugh. Laughter is truly a gift that brings joy and connection to people, making life more enjoyable and memorable.

Laughter is a powerful force that brings people together and enhances happiness. It has a contagious nature that can uplift spirits and create bonds between individuals.
